LOGIN:

URL for MT-KA Provision is :156.5.190.138:8009

User have to login using Login option which is towards the right top corner of the screen,login screen will be displayed as shown below:

                                 

To log in into the application, user have to enter S1 authentication ID as username and password.

Title: Dashboard
Description:
After logged in the dashboard, the user will get access to only those menus or option for which the user got permissions as per his/her role.

If you login in this portal for the first time then you will see all sections are gray out.

After the login is successfully dashboard will appear as below screenshot:

Title: MOC Provision Status Meter
Description:
On the right side of the screen, 'MOC Provision Status Meter' is shown for the Year.

It has month-wise sections which can be selected. Here user can select the month, if the user wants to view reports for previous closed MOCs. If MOC JV is generated that month will be shown by Green Color. If MOC is created and is in progress or incomplete then it will be shown in Yellow Color. If MOC is not created, then it will be shown by Dark Gray Color.

Title: Download all file format
Description:
Download all file formats:

 

User can download format for all master by clicking on

Title: Create MOC
Description:
User have to follow the steps shown on dashboard sequentially to generate and export JV.

Lets go step by step…

Step 1: Click on New MOC icon   

 

Once you click on New MOC icon, Step1 (Upload Masters) and step2 (Upload Provision Master) will get enable to upload masters and MOC Provision Status Meter will be in yellow color for the current month.

Title: Step 1: Upload Master
Description:
If the user wants to upload masters, then the user needs to select the 'Upload Master option'. After selecting upload masters option following screen will be shown:

 

 Here user has four options:

  1. Introduction

  2. Customer Group

  3. SKU Dump

  4. Sales Tax Rate 

User have to select II,III,IV options one by one to upload data.

 

If the user wants to upload 'Customer Group', then the user needs to select the Customer Group option in the Vertical menu as shown in left hand side of the screen. Then screen will be displayed as below:

Click on     to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select and upload the file

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 After selecting file click on , data will be uploaded and populated in the table then screen will be displayed as below:

(While Uploading file for respective master, file should be in .xls or .xlsx format, File should consist customer code and Region Column).

User can search data using search option.

User can download the uploaded file by clicking the  the Download button.

Also user can delete    unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows.

  

Audit trail:

If user deletes entries from masters, then those entries will be available for the user in audit trail section with information like who has deleted the entries on which date and what time.

Also updated values in the file gets reflected in audit trail having in a green background in respective column with status of opration and details of users 

To see audit Trail click on  which is next to download button on masters.

 

 

There are two choices for user to see data.

I)Show all

II) Filter by Date

 

 I)Show all

 user will able to see all the data.

 

 

II) Filter by Date

User can sort the data date wise to see the result.

 User can search data using search option.

User can download uploaded file by clicking button.

 

 If user wants to upload SKU Dump, then the user needs to select the 'SKU Dump' option in the Vertical menu shown in left hand side of the screen.

  

Click on  to upload file. (User can upload files in two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload. 

After selecting file click on  , data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

(While Uploading file for respective master, file should be in .xls or .xlsx format, File should consist Base Packcode, Tax code Column).

User can search data using search option.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the  the Download button.

Also the user can delete  unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows.

Audit trail option is also avaible for user to see who has updated and deleted data with user details. 

 

 

If user wants to upload Sales Tax Rate, then the user needs to select Sales Tax Rate option in the Vertical menu shown in left hand side of the screen.

 

 

Click on    to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload. 

After selecting file click on , data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

(While Uploading file for respective master, file should be in .xls or .xlsx format, File should consist TaxCode, StateCode, SalesTaxRate Column).

User can search data using search option.

User can download uploaded file by clicking  the Download button.

Also the user can delete   unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows. 

Audit trail option is also avaible for user to see who has updated and deleted data with user details.

Title: Step 2: Upload Provision Master
Description:
Step 2: Upload Provision Master:

 Step 2 can be selected by selecting the ICON shown on dashboard as shown in below picture:

In this step all provision masters required to calculate provision are uploaded.

After selecting step 2 i.e. Upload Provision Master screen will look like as below:

In above picture Introduction of Upload Provision Master is shown.

Before starting the data upload for master download, the upload format from the icon Download file formats menu. Masters can be uploaded as full upload or as an incremental upload. Default is incremental upload.

While doing an incremental upload, ensure that the file has only relevant data which needs to be updated.

On selecting full upload, system will automatically delete all the relevant data for current MOC and upload fresh data

 

User have to select Provision masters one by one to upload. List of Provision Masters is displayed as in above picture.

If user wants to upload Outlet Master, then the user needs to select Outlet Master option from the left hand side

Click on   to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 

After selecting file, data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

(While Uploading file for respective master, file should be in .xls or .xlsx format, File should consist

HUL Outlet Code, Chain Name, Group Name, Color/Non color Column).

User can search data column wise for every column search option is available.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the Download button.

Also the user can delete  unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows.

 

If user wants to upload Additional Margin Master , then the user needs to select Additional Margin Master option from the left hand side

Click on to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 

After selecting file, data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

(While Uploading file for respective master, file should be in .xls or .xlsx format, File should consist

RS Code, RS Name, Chain name, Group name, Price List, % to be applied Column).

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the  Download button.

Also the user can delete  unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows

 

 

If user wants to upload Service Tax Master then then the user needs to select Service Tax Master from the left hand side.

Click on  to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 

After selecting file, data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

(While Uploading file for respective master, file should be in .xls or .xlsx format, File should consist

Chain Name, Group Name, Rate Column).

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the  Download button.

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows

 

 

If the users want to upload Huggies Base Pack Percentage , then the user needs to select Huggies Base Pack Percentage from the left hand side.

Click on to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 

After selecting file, data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

(While Uploading file for respective master, file should be in .xls or .xlsx format, File should consist

Huggies Basepack Code, SKUs Description, Percentage Column).

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the  Download button.

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows

 

 

If user wants to upload Cluster RS Code Mapping, then the user needs to select 'Cluster RS Code Mapping' option from the left hand side.

Click on to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 

After selecting file, data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

(While Uploading file for respective master, file should be in .xls or .xlsx format, File should consist

Cluster Code, RS Code Column).

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the Download button.

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows

 

 

If user wants to upload MT Tier Based TOT % Master, then the user needs to select 'MT Tier Based TOT %' Master from the left hand side .

Click on to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 

After selecting file, data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

(While Uploading file for respective master, file should be in .xls or .xlsx format, File should consist

Chain Name,Group Name,Tier,Color / Non Color,Price List,On Invoice %,Monthly Off Invoice %, Qtrly Off, Invoice % Column).

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the Download button.

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows

 

 

If user wants to upload MT Subcategory Mapping, then the user needs to select 'MT Subcategory Mapping' option from the left hand side.

Click on to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 

After selecting file, data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

(While Uploading file for respective master, file should be in .xls or .xlsx format, File should consist

PMH Brand,PMH Brand Name,Sales Sub-Category,Price List,TOT% Sub Category,NameColumn).

User can search data column wise for every column search option is available.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the Download button.

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows.

 

 

 

If user wants to upload MT Subcategory TOT % Master, then the user needs to select 'MT Subcategory TOT %' Master from the left hand side.

Here user can upload the file for:

a) On Invoice

b) Off Invoice Monthly

c) Off Invoice Quarterly

 

For On Invoice:

Click on  to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 

 

Once you select file for upload, system will ask for option as shown below:

Select On invoice option.

 

After selecting On Invoice option, data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the Download button.

 

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows.

For Off Invoice Monthly:

Click on to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 

 

Once you select file for upload, system will ask for option as shown below:

Select Off Invoice Monthly option.

After selecting Off Invoice Monthly option, data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

 

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the Download button.

 

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows.

For Off Invoice Quarterly :

Click on to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 

 

Once you select file for upload, system will ask for option as shown below:

Select Off Invoice Quarterly option.

After selecting Off Invoice Monthly option, data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the Download button.

 

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that single or multiple rows.

If user wants to Add PriceList Master, then the user needs to select 'PriceList Master' from the left hand side

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that row.

 

To add PriceList Master click on 

 

 

One small window will pop up, add chain name and click on save to add price list master

To edit PriceList Master Click on 

Make changes and save the changes.

By clicking ‘Cancel’ changes will not be saved.

 

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

 

Also the user can delete the unwanted row by selecting that row.

If user wants to Add On InvoiceConfig Master, then the user needs to select 'On InvoiceConfig' Master from the left hand side

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

 

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that row.

To add On InvoiceConfig Master click on 

One small window will populate, add New State Code and click on save to add On InvoiceConfig master:

To edit On InvoiceConfig Master Click on 

Make changes and save the changes.

By clicking ‘Cancel’ changes will not save.

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

 

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that row.

If user wants to Add Chain Name Master, then the user needs to select 'Chain Name Master' from left hand side.

To add Chain Name click on 

 

One small window will populate, add new chain name and click on save to add Chain Name Master

To edit Chain Name Master Click on 

Make changes and save the changes.

 

By clicking ‘Cancel’ changes will not be saved.

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

 

Also the user can delete unwanted row by selecting that row.

If user wants to see and edit GL Master, then the user needs to select 'GL Master' from left hand side.

 

To edit GL Master Click on 

Make changes and save the changes.

By clicking ‘Cancel’ changes will not be saved.

 

User can search data using search option available on the right hand side of the table.

Title: Step 3: Upload Secondary Sales
Description:
Step 3: Upload Secondary Sales

 

Step 3 can be selected by selecting the ICON shown on dashboard as shown in below picture:

Click on  to upload file. (User can upload files in a two ways)

1) Select file and upload it

2) Simply drag and drop file which the user wants to upload.

 

After selecting file, data will be uploaded and populated in the table.

(While Uploading file for respective master, file should be in .xls or .xlsx format)

User can search data column wise for every column search option is available.

 

User can download uploaded file by clicking the Download button.

Title: Step 4: Calculate GSV
Description:
Step 4: Calculate GSV

Step 4 can be selected by selecting the ICON shown on dashboard as shown in below picture:

After selecting the above option following dialogue with a button will be displayed on the dashboard, it will look like below picture.

After Clicking on the button “Calculate Gross Sales (GSV)” next dialogue will be displayed on screen as below:

Here it will show two options

  1. View Calculated Gross Sales Value (GSV) :

 

This option is for Calculating Gross Sales Value (GSV) on the basis of the data uploaded in previous steps.

User can search data column wise for every column search option is available.

User can download uploaded file by clicking the Download button.

 

  1. Export calculated Gross Sales Value(GSV) :

 

This option is for Exporting Calculated Gross Sales Value (GSV) to the file.

Title: Step 5: Calculate Provision
Description:
Step 5: Calculate Provision

Step 5 can be selected by selecting the ICON shown on dashboard as shown in below picture:

After selecting the above option following dialogue with a button will be diplayed on the dashboard, it will look like below picture.

 

After pressing the button “Calculate Provision” dialogue will be displayed on screen as below:

Here it will show two options

  1. View Calculated Provision:

 

This option is for Calculating Provision on the basis of the data uploaded in previous steps as well as Gross Sales Value (GSV).

User can search data column wise, for every column search option is available.

 

User can download the uploaded file by clicking the Download button.

 

  1. Export Calculated Provision:

 

This option is for Exporting Calculated Provision to the file.

Title: Step 6: Generate JV
Description:
Step 6: Generate JV

 

Step 6 can be selected by selecting the ICON shown on dashboard as shown in below picture:

After selecting the above option following dialogue with a button will be displayed on the dashboard, it will look like below picture.

After Clicking the button “Generate JV”  it will show "Generate JV done Sucessfully!" message box and you will be navigated to the dashboard.

Title: Step 7: Export JV
Description:
Step 7: Export JV

This option is for exporting JV data generated in previous step based on uploaded masters and calculated GSV and Provision.

 

Step 7 can be selected by selecting the ICON shown on dashboard as shown in below picture:

After selecting the above option following dialogue with a button will be displayed on the dashboard, it will look like below picture.

Here it will show three options:

  1. Export On Invoice:

  1. Export Off Invoice

  2. Export Off Invoice Qtrly.

 User can download JV for Invoice,Off Invoice,Off Invoice Qtrly.

Title: Step 8:Close MOC:
Description:
Step 8: Close MOC:

This option is for deactivating current MOC.

 

Step 8 can be selected by selecting the ICON shown on dashboard as shown in below picture:

After selecting the above option following dialogue with a button will be displayed on the dashboard, it will look like below picture.

Title: Reopen MOC
Description:
Reopen MOC:

This option is for to open latest closed MOC only. In that user can upload masters, calculate GSV, Calculate Provision.

Once you reopen the Latest MOC then MOC provision status meter will turn Green to yellow color, dashboard will look as follows:

Title: Reports
Description:
Reports:

Select from header. Screen will look as shown below

Reports are of following types as shown in below picture.

Calculate GSV:

User can see and download calculated GSV.

 

User can search data column wise for every column search option is available.

Calculate Provision:

User can see and download calculated Provision.

 

User can search data column wise for every column search option is available.

JV-OnInvoice:

User can see and download JV-OnInvoice.

 

User can search data using search option.

JV-OffInvoice Monthly:

 

User can see and download JV-OffInvoice Monthly.

User can search data using search option.

JV-OffInvoice Qtrly :

User can see and download JV-OffInvoice Qtrly.

 

User can search data using search option.

Customer wise report:

 

In this report the user can see OnInvoice , off Invoice and Qtr-off invoice details customer-wise.

if “There are some Outlet Codes are missing.Please correct them “this type of error will appears on window then the user needs to select exception report option and check which outlet codes are missing,according to that the user have to add missing basepacks in to outletmaster then only he will able to see customer wise report.

Exception Report:

GSV Exception Report:

 

This shows the customer codes for which State code are missing and Basepack codes for which Tax code are missing. In this reports we are showing those secondary sales data where Tax Code and State codes are missing.

e.g. on server,

• Customer Code: 130494 (State code is not defined in Customer Group master)

• Basepack Code: 80101 (Tax code is not defined in SKU dump Master)

 

Click on GSV button, in that user will see the missing chain Name and Group name for respective outlet code.

Provision Exceptions Report

I) Missing Outlet code

II) Missing TOT Sub-Category.

I) Missing Outlet Code Exception report

This shows the HUL Outlet codes for which Chain Name, Group Name and Color/Non Color not defined in Outlet Master.

e.g. on server, following Outlet is missing in Outlet Master

HULOutletCode: HUL-431347P67

HULOutlet Name: CHANDRAGIRI ENTERPRISES-NILGIRIS

 

In this section user will see missing outletcode for calculate provision

II) Missing TOT Sub-Category:

TOT Subcategory Mapping Exception Report- This report shows the combinations of (PMH Brand code, PMH Brand Name, Sales SubCategory and Price List) for which SubCategory mapping is not defined.

e.g. on server, following combination is missing in TOT Subcategory Mapping Master

PMH Brand: BPTW

PMH Brand Name: PEPSODENT TOOTHPASTE

Sales SubCategory: SG_BB01101 : TOOTH PASTE

Price List: PP

In this section user will see missing TOT Sub-Category for calculate provision

Zero Provision Outlet Report:

this report will show those outlet code whose tot provision is zero.

User can search data column wise for every column search option is available.

 

 

Provision Trend Analysis:

this report shows sales (TUR),TOTvalue and Tot% monthwise

Provision trend category wise:

This report shows sales (TUR),TOTvalue and Tot% Categorywise

Title: Security
Description:
Security :

 The icon which is available on the header of dashboard is for setting user roles, assign access, and creating new users. In below picture three options are showing Roles, Users, Assign Access. And the list of roles is displayed in grid view because Roles is selected (which is shown filled by blue background)

Roles:

 

 

Here user can add Roles By selecting Right Top corner of the Grid View, user can create new role.

User can search role name using search option.

 

As shown below

And by selecting the action user can delete the role.

Users:

 

user who have s1 authentiacation Id only that user can login into this portal

Here new user can add Roles By selecting Right Top corner of the Grid View,As shown below:

User can search user name using search option.

And by selecting the action user can delete the role.

Assign Access:

User can assign read,write,extract,execute functionality to selected roles from drop-down list .

 

Select the role which you want to give access to master by checking the check box and click on update.
